metadata.synopsis: Dialog after final confrontation with Rolan. Depending on whether he joined Nightsong team or not or if Lorroakan died or not different branches will be chosen.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1- oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_NightsongGo2- Go to CTY_Main_A 4960; 0; 705 start dialogue 3- End combat after dialogue4- Talk to Rolan

3.speaker: Rolan
3.text: Forgive me - I am in the middle of a most interesting speculation on alchemical blood.
3.context: NodeContext: Looking down - studying something. Wishes to be left in peace.

6.speaker: Rolan
6.text: I need time to cage the Nightsong - kindly give me some.
6.context: NodeContext: touch annoyed at the interruption

8.speaker: Rolan
8.text: Lorroakan is dead. The bastard is dead.
8.context: NodeContext: His master has just died and he helped. Mix of emotions - relieved, angry, disbelief

90.speaker: Rolan
90.text: I am - now that the bastard's in bits.
90.context: NodeContext: relieved - with a hint of sadness at what he's gone through

78.speaker: Player
78.text: 'Bastard'? I thought he was your master.

45.speaker: Rolan
45.context: NodeContext: clenched fists, he's delighted lorroakan is dead

46.speaker: Rolan
46.text: Lorroakan was a cruel and vicious man. By day, I'd tend the shop, but at night - he'd fire the most nonsensical questions at me.
46.context: NodeContext: lost in a painful memory

75.speaker: Rolan
75.text: And for every one I answered 'wrong', he'd beat me. I could've killed him with my own two hands, but I kept thinking it was all a test. It had to be.
75.context: NodeContext: voice distant with remembered pain

5.speaker: Rolan
5.text: I thought it was the price I had to pay to become a true wizard. I realise now he was just a sick, sick man.
5.context: NodeContext: eyes closed at the beginning (maybe?) dissapointed in himself for trusting lorroakan

54.speaker: Player
54.text: He's dead now. It's over - and you've won.

26.speaker: Rolan
26.text: I have. With your considerable help.

81.speaker: Rolan
81.text: I see things clearly now. If I wish to master the Weave, I must do it myself.

9.speaker: Rolan
9.text: Thankfully, I have everything I need - right here.
9.context: NodeContext: big smile, full of pride - gesturing to the magical tower he stands in - he has achieved his dream. Holds arms out wide

44.speaker: Player
44.text: All hail Rolan, master of Ramazith's Tower.

84.speaker: Rolan
84.text: Oh, I like the sound of that! I do indeed.

50.speaker: Rolan
50.text: I'll move Cal and Lia in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let them stay here. They are going to love the tower.
50.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

21.speaker: Rolan
21.text: I'll move Cal in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let him stay here. He is going to love the library.
21.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

19.speaker: Rolan
19.text: I'll move Lia in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let her stay here. She is going to love the armoury.
19.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

27.speaker: Rolan
27.text: I wouldn't have this - the tower, my family - without you. What can I do to thank you?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: The city is under siege, from the inside out. I need allies.

25.speaker: Rolan
25.text: And you'll have me. I'll learn everything I can about the tower in the meantime - even if I have to rip this place apart.

73.speaker: Rolan
73.text: But know this - Ramazith's Tower, and its master, are now your friends. And when the time comes, we will stand by you as allies.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Do what you can to protect the people of Baldur's Gate.

79.speaker: Rolan
79.text: I will. I'll be the ruler of Ramazith's Tower they deserve - not some vicious recluse who hides from the world.

37.speaker: Rolan
37.text: Myself and this tower are now your allies. When the time comes, we will stand by you however necessary.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'm sure this place has some interesting trinkets you can part with...

83.speaker: Rolan
83.text: What's mine is yours - take what you please. Leave only the books and scrolls.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You'll be challenged. I'm sure there are others who want the tower.

41.speaker: Rolan
41.text: Let them come. I happened across a book on the tower's defences, and they are considerable.
41.context: NodeContext: a sly smile - a touch of his old arrogance (but in a charming way)

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Will a room of dusty tomes really help that much?

58.speaker: Rolan
58.text: Oh, it'll take longer than if I had a master. But I won't entrust my fate to another - not again.
58.context: NodeContext: determined with a hint of remembered pain

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I only wish I could kill Lorroakan all over again.

63.speaker: Rolan
63.text: I only wish I'd had the pleasure.

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: It will take time to tame the Nightsong, but we will do it, I have no doubt.
17.context: NodeContext: more demure and restrained then our usual rolan - he's sided with lorroakan and is now his eternal apprentice

29.speaker: Rolan
29.text: You let my family die - and then you kill my master? Have you made it your personal mission to ruin my life?

64.speaker: Rolan
64.text: No more - I'll drag you through all Nine Hells myself.
64.context: NodeContext: fritted teeth - vicious. About to start combat

42.speaker: Rolan
42.text: We bested the Nightsong and lived. Lorroakan, however, was not so fortunate.

70.speaker: Rolan
70.text: Indeed. And all the preparation in the world wouldn't have saved the charlatan from an aasimar.

4.speaker: Rolan
4.text: Why, my friend, we take what's ours.

68.speaker: Rolan
68.text: Lorroakan was a vicious bastard - he beat me for the smallest of transgressions.

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: He was never going to show me the secrets of Ramazith's Tower. Instead, he'd merely string me along - like a faithful cub.

66.speaker: Rolan
66.text: But now, I don't need him. I have the tower. I have the Nightsong.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Look, I just want to get paid.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: And if I want the Nightsong for myself?

14.speaker: Rolan
14.text: Do you happen to have a soul cage lying about with which to contain the limitless power of a furious aasimar?

35.speaker: Rolan
35.text: Here. Your fee for bringing the Nightsong to me. Lorroakan used me as his purse-holder - idiot needed his fingers to count.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: What are you going to do to Nightsong?

85.speaker: Rolan
85.text: Finish what Lorroakan started, of course. I shall cage her and channel her invulnerability.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You must be pleased - you've got what you wanted.

102.speaker: Rolan
102.text: Indeed. I thought it would be an age before Lorroakan keeled over - leaving me Ramazith's Tower.

59.speaker: Rolan
59.text: I suppose I owe Nightsong some thanks for speeding up the process.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: A paltry sum for saving you.

74.speaker: Rolan
74.text: Then consider the power that awaits us once I cage the Nightsong and channel her invulnerability.

32.speaker: Rolan
32.text: I have mere notes and scrolls to go by - but if that moron Lorroakan can do it, I doubtless can.

98.speaker: Rolan
98.text: But first, I must cage the aasimar. After that, I have an eternity to begin.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You mean we have all this - the tower is mine as much as yours.

13.speaker: Rolan
13.text: What's mine is yours, friend. But you and I just rendered a celestial unconscious. A very angry celestial.

94.speaker: Rolan
94.text: I have access to Ramazith's notes, and I have the best chance of dealing with her before she wakes up and murders us both.

87.speaker: Rolan
87.text: Here. Take Lorroakan's gold in the meantime - spend it as you wish.

53.speaker: Rolan
53.text: I won't hide behind lies and cheap tricks like Lorroakan. I will rule this tower as it should be - I swear it. Thank you, my friend.

71.speaker: Rolan
71.text: Seeing what Master Lorroakan is capable of, I know my place is here. Thank you - for settling any doubts.
71.context: NodeContext: more demure and restrained then our usual rolan - he's sided with lorroakan and is now his eternal apprentice

92.speaker: Rolan
92.text: What in the hells happened here?
92.context: NodeContext: looking around in shock and horror - accusation towards the player

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Lorroakan wanted to imprison and torture my friend Nightsong. I couldn't let him hurt her.

28.speaker: Rolan
28.text: The Nightsong was a person? Yet he still planned to harvest her life? I shouldn't be surprised.
28.context: NodeContext: surprise but then brings it back - thinking about his own situation

30.speaker: Rolan
30.text: You don't understand - I worked my entire life to become Lorroakan's apprentice. And you've ruined it - I can't let you get away with this.
30.context: NodeContext: sad but determined - he's going to kill the player

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Lorroakan wanted to exploit Aylin just like Ketheric did, so I beat some sense into him. Do you have a problem with that?

49.speaker: Rolan
49.text: Hardly - it doesn't take a 'great wizard' to see that both men deserved to die. In fact - you've done me a favour.
49.context: NodeContext: 'you've done me a favour' sad - a bit ashamed at what he's about to explain (about lorroakan beating him)

10.speaker: Rolan
10.text: You just want Ramazith's Tower for yourself, don't you? No - I refuse to bow to another!

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I killed Ketheric, now Lorroakan. Do you want to be the next 'great' wizard to die?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Same thing that's going to happen to you.

91.speaker: Rolan
91.text: It's come to this, has it? Fine - I will avenge my master.
91.context: NodeContext: vicious - about to start combat

97.speaker: Rolan
97.text: I knew Lorroakan amassed knowledge like a dragon with its hoard, but never could I have imagined such wealth.
97.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - he can't believe all this is his now

88.speaker: Rolan
88.text: And the tower itself has a cannon! The sheer power is mind-boggling.
88.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - he can't believe all this is his now

93.speaker: Player
93.text: What are you going to do with the knowledge you've discovered?

12.speaker: Rolan
12.text: Study and catalogue it - Lorroakan barely knew his alphabet.

57.speaker: Rolan
57.text: Then share it with the Realms. After all, it does little good collecting dust in an old tower.
57.context: NodeContext: smile - half the reason he's doing this is because the player inspired him

52.speaker: Player
52.text: A magical cannon? That could come in useful.

24.speaker: Rolan
24.text: Indeed - I must still figure out its intricacies, but I am close.
24.context: NodeContext: gesturing to the table in front of him

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'll let you study in peace.

0.speaker: Rolan
0.context: NodeContext: Looking down at the table in front of him, studying something
